thread.title_full: Consol Energy plans to sell or spin out coal business

author: Daniel Moore / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Consol Energy plans to sell or spin out coal business
text:
Consol Energy plans to sell or spin out coal business January 31, 2017 10:02 AM Consol Energy Inc. A machine cutting slabs of coal inside Consol Energy's Bailey Mine in southwestern Pennsylvania. By Daniel Moore / Pittsburgh Post-Gazette Email 
Consol Energy is planning to sell or spin-out its coal business as early as this year, the Cecil-based energy company announced this morning in a fourth-quarter earnings release. 
The plan is another step in the company’s strategy to separate its coal business from its natural gas operations. Consol spun out some of its coal assets in 2015 to form CNX Coal Resources. 
“We think there may be a market opportunity to achieve a sale of the coal business on favorable terms or, alternatively, to effect a spin-off as our leverage ratio comes down to a level that allows each business to stand on its own,” said David M. Khani, Consol’s chief financial officer, in a statement. 
Meanwhile, Consol reported a fourth-quarter loss of $306 million, or $1.33 a share, down from a profit of $34. 3 million, or 13 cents per share, during the year-ago quarter. 
For the full year, the company lost $848 million, or $3.70 a share, compared with a loss of $374.9 million in 2015. 
During the fourth quarter, the average sales prices that Consol got for its natural gas improved to $2.22 per thousand cubic feet, up from $1.83 per thousand cubic feet a year ago. 
The company will discuss earnings with investors and analysts during a 10 a.m. conference call.
